This is a really late review but I felt like going through all my old games and reviewing what I haven't already.

I don't think I can say much about this game that hasn't already been said, but I will anyway.

Amazing, capitvating story that has stuck with me for years. Great characters with hints of really good comedy here and there. The story and characters is definitely the best part of Portal 2. Tons of easter eggs that hint to a deeper story, leaving many things for the fans and player to figure out and discover over time. 

Extremely smooth gameplay with super fun controls and physics. Not only does it have an amazing story but the whole premise of solving puzzles using the portal gun is awesome in itself and this sequel introduces so many more things to toy with. Multiplayer is amazing to play with friends, even after years of having the game, and makes for some funny moments of vaporizing your friends or aiming turrets at them.

In general a really great game and will always be my favorite Valve game. Honestly, if you haven't played portal, or at least seen gameplay of it, YOU NEED TO PLAY IT.

Portal 2 is a first-person puzzle-platform video game developed and published by Valve Corporation. It is the sequel to Portal (2007) and was released on April 19, 2011 for Microsoft Windows, OS X, Linux, PlayStation 3, and Xbox 360. The retail versions of the game were published by Electronic Arts, while online distribution of the PC versions is handled by Valve's content delivery service Steam. Portal 2 was announced in March 2010, following a week-long alternate reality game based on new patches to the original game. Before the game's release on Steam, the company released the Potato Sack, a second multi-week alternate reality game, involving 13 independently developed titles which culminated in a distributed computing spoof to release Portal 2 several hours early.
The game retains Portal's gameplay elements, and adds new features, including tractor beams, laser redirection, bridges made of light, and paint-like 'gels' accelerating the player's speed, allowing the player-character to jump higher or place portals on any surface. In the single-player campaign, the player controls protagonist Chell, awoken from suspended animation after many years, who must navigate the now-dilapidated Aperture Science Enrichment Center during its reconstruction by the reactivated GLaDOS, a powerful supercomputer. The storyline introduces new characters, including Wheatley (Stephen Merchant) and Cave Johnson (J. K. Simmons). Ellen McLain reprised the role of GLaDOS. Jonathan Coulton and The National each produced a song for the game. Portal 2 also includes a two-player cooperative mode, in which the robotic player-characters Atlas and P-Body (both voiced by Dee Bradley Baker) are each given a portal gun and are required to work together to solve puzzles. Valve provided post-release support for the game, including additional downloadable content and a simplified map editor to allow players to create and share test chambers with others.
Although some reviewers initially expressed concerns about the difficulty of expanding Portal into a full sequel, Portal 2 received critical acclaim, particularly for its writing, pacing, and dark humor. The voice work of McLain, Merchant, and Simmons were also praised, as were the new gameplay elements, the challenging but surmountable learning curve, and the additional cooperative mode. Some journalists ranked Portal 2 among the best games of 2011, and several named it their Game of the Year. Portal 2 has since been hailed as one of the greatest video games of all time.

Un jeu incroyable, bien meilleur que le premier en terme de gameplay, de level design, de durée de vie, et de musique (selon moi). 



Le gameplay est globalement le même que dans le premier Portal: passer des salles pour progresser dans l'histoire avec quelques niveaux spéciaux de "fuite". Les éléments de gameplay dans les niveaux se révéleront au déroulement du jeu, que se soit [spoiler]les "rayons tracteurs", les "ponts de lumière tangible" ou les différents types de gels[/spoiler]. Ils devronts être manipulés avec les portails pour résoudre certaines énigmes, ce qui laisse un grand potentiel de création de niveau. On ne retrouve cependant pas les boules d'énergie du premier jeu, dont les énigmes étaient principalement basées sur ceux-ci. La difficulté est bien dosée, assez progressive (le boss de fin peut-être un peu simple...).

La durée de vie de l'histoire principale est au minimum 5x plus longue que dans le 1, avec des décors beaucoup plus variés et réalistes dans l'ambiance de l'univers de Portal. Valve a également intégré la fonctionnalité de créer ses propres niveaux et de les partager sur le workshop de Portal 2. Je me permet donc de considérer que la durée de ce jeu est en réalité infinie, grâce à tout le potentiel des éléments de gameplay du jeu et de la créativité des joueurs.

Les musiques de ce jeu s'intègrent bien dans l'univers de Portal et du centre immense d'Aperture. Les musiques seront angoissantes quand les niveaux seront angoissants, elles seront stressantes quand les niveaux le seront. La BO a été composé par Mike Morasky, comme la majorité des jeux Valve (Half Life, Team Forteresse 2, CS:GO, Left 4 Dead, ...). De plus, vous n'aurez aucun problème pour la télécharger légalement car elle est gratuite sur Steam, et disponible sur vos fichiers locaux et sur: [i]https://www.thinkwithportals.com/music.php[/i]. Le sound-design et le doublage vf ont eux aussi l'attention du détail.

Ce jeu ajoute également une fonction "co-op" pour jouer à deux dans Portal 2, dans des salles conçues pour, que ce soit avec des amis ou des joueurs en ligne. (ce mode de jeu peut également être créé avec l'éditeur de niveau intégré que je n'ai pas encore expérimenté).

Le seul "manquant" de ce jeu, c'est l'histoire d'Aperture Science qui reste encore un peu floue... Même si c'est probablement l'intention de Valve pour garder leur univers un peu vague.



Bref, largement rentable pour 8€,  (je conseil d'avoir joué au premier avant celui-ci)

Un juego muy entretenido donde tienes que pensar para resolver distintos puzzles. Una historia muy buena, que claramente es la continuacion de Portal 1, el cual tambien recomiendo mucho. No es dificil solo es un poco de logica.

一周目十小时通关，难度还算友好，没有太难为玩家的地方。关卡设计精巧，难度递进渐增。本作相对前代更为出色的一点是剧情的扩充和丰富。与许多游戏不一样的是，本作的剧情完全是一个增光点，转折出人意料，而不是为了搭配游戏本体的“鸡肋”存在。
       值得一提的是创意工坊中各地玩家制作的地图，极大扩充了游戏的可玩性。
       总之，《Portal2》是一款上手难度小，可玩性较强的佳作。

I have completed both the single player and co-op portions of the game.  

Portal 2 only has one flaw, and that is that there is little to no replayability. (See caveat below)

The co-op portion of this game is the best game I have ever played.  I have played almost every triple A MMO out there, many for extended (years) of time, and this game provides the most fun and challenging experience out of any multiplayer game.  I don't think that there is a single negative thing I could say about it.  

My wife and I did take longer than expected (this was our first time, no Portal experience), to complete the co-op, and neither of us ran the campaign (single player) mode on Portal 2.  That was fine.  I wish we could have dragged it out longer, but unfortunately once we ran out of content that was it.  

This was a good game to grab some food and just look around, eat a few bites and contemplate how we could work a puzzle.  Several times we were completely stumped and just kept working at it until the mission was complete.  Not once did we look up a guide to see how things were supposed to be done, although I am curious now if a few of the ways we completed missions were not the "correct" ways.  

I played through the single player version of the game and it was great.  The first stages of it were extremely easy as expected because they teach the mechanics that you also learn in the multiplayer version.  The end-game chambers were still challenging and I had a lot of fun, albeit not quite as much fun in multiplayer.  If the game was strictly single player I would still recommend it, but only if it had many more maps.  For multiplayer I recommend the game hands down, and since it has both, this should be the easiest purchase you ever make on Steam.  

Portal 2 is the BEST co-op game you can purchase.  Get through your first few chambers and understand how the mechanics work.  You will love it.

edit:  There is some replayability with player created content, but I generally do not use unofficial content, so use at your own risk.  Even at that point, it is one chamber at a time.

Sin duda, en mi opinión, uno de los mejores juegos de la historia, tanto por su jugabilidad como por su historia. Ambientación excelente, diseño impecable, soundtrack fascinante. Este juego tiene bastantes Easter Eggs, lo cual suma bastantes puntos (personalmente). Los villanos me encantan, tienen su encanto y carisma; algunos de sus diálogos son bastante hilarantes.
[spoiler][b]GLaDOS[/b]: Well, this is the part where﻿ he kills you
[b]Wheatley[/b]: Hello, this is the part where I kill you!
[b]Chapter 9: The Part Where He Kills You [/b]
[i]Achievment: The Part Where He Kill You[/i][/spoiler]
El final me pareció muy emotivo; la canción es bellísima. La canción de los créditos me dejó con un aire melancólico, ya que quedé con ganas de más Portal. [spoiler]WE F*CKING NEED PORTAL 3[/spoiler]
[b]Punto a considerar:[/b] Si no te agrada estar haciendo lo mismo una y otra y otra vez, quizá te moleste un poco... pero este juego [u]vale totalmente la pena; nunca te deja de sorprender[/u] [spoiler]y los posibles dolores de cabeza y estrés por los puzzles[/spoiler].
Sin pensarlo mucho, este juego vale cada peso invertido en él. Totalmente recomendado. [spoiler]SÓLO CÓMPRALO[/spoiler].

Portal 2 takes the first game and ramps it up 2X. It has better puzzles, character and a little more back story on what the heck is going on. Another good reason to play is after you finish single player campaign, there is a Co-Op campaign. If that doesn't tickle your fancy, this game also has Portal map creator to test your own or other players puzzles.

Плюсы: Есть возможность играть с другом.
Минусы: Друзей у меня нет.

Almost everyone on my friends list has this game. It's insanely popular and no wonder... It's simple to play but also an intrigingly complicated game that people of all ages can enjoy. It uses a few elements used in different ways to solve a larger puzzle and escape the room. But for those who aren't interested in escape the room games, it uses portals to move around the stage to solve the puzzle --interested now? For some people, like my wife (a beautiful and highly intelligent person), going into a portal facing one direction and coming out a different portal facing a different direction can be confusing. However the single player game will introduce you to the concept of using portals gradually and will have you feel like a mastermind before too long.

It's the game we play when we're bored or don't have a lot of other games in common. It's a game that you can keep coming back to. Portal 2 has an unlimited amount of levels to play and I would go as far as claiming that this game will be timeless -remembered for many years to come.

If you tend to play alone, this game has a great story which will amuse you the whole way through. When you're done you can create your own levels for others to beat or play someone elses (they're not all good, but soo many are).

If you're not sure if you should get this game or not. Get it. You won't regret it. It a cheap price for endless hours of amusement.

Пожалуй Portal 2 - одна из тех игр, с которыми можно провести большую часть своего досуга с пользой, развитием мозга, продумыванием различных тактик и стратегий прохождения уровней. Ведь в какой еще игре может сочетаться юмор от весёлых роботов и сложные головоломки!?
Компания Valve изрядно постаралась, создавая эту игру, продумывая всё, до мельчайших деталей, и выпуская данный продукт. В отличие от первой части, Portal 2 имеет интересный сюжет, грамотно преподнесённый игрокам, что даёт интерес к игре.
Плюсы:
1.+Интересный Сюжет.
2.+Хорошие головоломки с различными предметами.
3.+Multiplayer.
4.+Графика.(Ну и так всем понятно!)
5.+Низкие системные требования.
6.+Игра для любого возвраста.(Желательно играть детям,для развития интелекта).
7.+Карточки,4 шт.на изи.
8.+Много Достижений.
Минусы:
1.-Баги.(во всех играх присутствуют баги,так что нечего к этому так сильно цеплятся).
2.-Короткий Сюжет.(прошел за 7 ч.)
Моя оценка этой игры:8 из 10.
